text: The Nive (, ) is a river in France. It flows through the Pyrénées-Atlantiques department, Nouvelle-Aquitaine region. The river starts in the Pyrenees. It is a left tributary of the Adour river. ==Geography== The Nive river has a length of , and a drainage basin with an area of approximately . Its average yearly discharge (volume of water which passes through a section of the river per unit of time) is at Cambo-les-Bains in the Pyrénées-Atlantiques department. It joins the Adour in the city of Bayonne, on its left bank, at an altitude of and at about from the Bay of Biscay (Atlantic Ocean). ==Main tributaries == Left tributaries: * Nive d'Arnéguy - * Nive des Aldudes - * Bastan - Right tributaries: * Laurhibar - * Lakako Erreka - ==Gallery== File:Ixassou Nive.jpg|The Nive at Itxassou File:Saint Jean Pied de Port Nive Béhérobie.jpg|Saint-Jean-Pied-de-Port (the Nive de Béhérobie) File:Bidarray Noblia Nive.jpg|Bidarray, the bridge Noblia over the Nive File:Ustaritz Pont Nive.jpg|Ustaritz, bridge over the Nive ==Related pages== * List of rivers of France == References == ==Other websites== * Tour de la Haute vallée de la Nive * Contrat de Rivière des Nives Category:Rivers of Nouvelle-Aquitaine
